messages.subject: Re: Radical vs.regular?
messages.msgSnippet: ... I say: I *taught* my kids to do their own laundry by procrastinating about doing the family s laundry myself.  (A fact of which I wasn t too proud at the
messages.messageBody:
Lillian said:

> <<Don't you ever have to do something you don't particularly
>
> want to do because it moves you along toward something you do want?>>
>

Sandra said:

> Never. But I very frequently CHOOSE to do something which moves me toward
> a
> goal.
>

I say:

I *taught* my kids to do their own laundry by procrastinating about doing the
family's laundry myself. (A fact of which I wasn't too proud at the time,
but the value of which I'm beginning to see in retrospect. :-) Therefore, I
frequently choose NOT to do something that I *ought,* and everything works out
fine in the end, anyway.

Take from THAT what you will. <g>

Laura B.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
